summary: This document is a set of grand jury subpoenas issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on July 5, 2019, commanding several individuals to appear and testify on July 24, 2019, regarding alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes. The subpoenas are accompanied by an 'Advice of Rights' notice and a request for confidentiality.

persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York

Berman, as U.S. Attorney, issued a grand jury subpoena to Brunel, compelling his testimony.

Berman, as U.S. Attorney, issued a grand jury subpoena to Wexner, compelling his testimony.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoenas
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued multiple grand jury subpoenas to individuals including Ghislaine Maxwell, Jean Luc Brunel, Leslie Groff, and Leslie Wexner.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoenaed individuals were commanded to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York, at 10:00 a.m. to testify.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, New York
The Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 5, 2019, the U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed key figures Ghislaine Maxwell, Jean Luc Brunel, Leslie Groff, and Leslie Wexner to testify before a grand jury.
The subpoenas relate to an investigation into alleged violations of federal statutes including sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. §§ 1591, 2421, 2422, 2423) and conspiracy (18 U.S.C. § 371).
The government requested that subpoena recipients voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The scheduled grand jury appearance for all named individuals was July 24, 2019, at 10:00 a.m. at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, New York.
The document includes multiple copies of the subpoena form, some with the recipient's name blank, suggesting a template used for several targets.
